intro: Meibomia plicata, commonly known as the pleated meibomia, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its pleated or folded leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Meibomia plicata produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often accompanied by small, oval-shaped fruits.
